p: In terms of berry quality over the considered time span, the final berry’s total soluble solids (TSS) and titratable acidity (TA) at full ripening in the white varieties were 22.3 ± 1.1 °Brix and 6.5 ± 1.0 mg·L −1 tartaric acid for the autochthonous GR variety, and 20.0 ± 1.9 °Brix and 8.6 ± 2.0 mg·L −1 tartaric acid, for the CH variety ( Table S2a). TA and pH of berry juice at harvest were influenced by thermal regime, expressed by the WI, HI (data not shown), and by the number of days with Tmax > 30 °C, showing a decreasing trend ( Figure 7a).
